intro: Susanna epaleacea, commonly known as the pale-flowered susanna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine pubescence. Susanna epaleacea thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
